content.description:
Ipse deum manifestomanifestus, -a, -um, adj. = clarus, -a, -um in lumine vidi1 
intrantem muros vocemque his auribus hausi. 
Desinedesino, -ere: to stop meque tuis incendereincendo, -ere = consumo, -ere teque querelisquerela, -ae, f.: complaint; 
Italiam non spontesponte, adv.: willingly sequor.
 1:Aeneas is the subject of vidi.↩
content.question: According to line 4 (Italiam...sequor), Aeneas acknowledges that the Fates

choices.label: govern even the actions of the gods
express their disapproval through natural phenomena

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 2.B: Describe historical and cultural contexts of Latin texts.
